link.title: Baldwin Park Unified School District: News & Announcements

img.alt: Baldwin Park Unified School District will be following the latest guidance, provided this week, by Governor Gavin Newsom, State Superintendent of Public Instruction Tony Thurmond, and Los Angeles County Office of Education Superintendent Debra Duardo, to keep our campuses physically closed, while continuing to provide instruction through remote learning until the end of the 2019-20 school year.

h2.a: BPUSD Extends Remote Learning for 2019-20 School Year

div.div:
Baldwin Park Unified School District will be following the latest guidance, provided this week, by Governor Gavin Newsom, State Superintendent of Public Instruction Tony Thurmond, and Los Angeles County Office of Education Superintendent Debra Duardo, to keep our campuses physically closed, while continuing to provide instruction through remote learning until the end of the 2019-20 school year.
Read More »

img.alt: If your student is in need of a device, please complete the online application no later than 11 a.m. Wednesday, April 22.

h2.a: BPUSD Hosts Make-up Chromebook Distribution Day

div.div:
If your student is in need of a device, please complete the online application no later than 11 a.m. Wednesday, April 22.
Read More »

img.alt: As our communities shelter at home to limit the spread of COVID-19, we can do many things to ensure our physical and emotional well-being.

h2.a: Health Tips for Nurturing Physical and Mental Well-being

img.alt: Baldwin Park Unified’s Special Education Department, psychology services, custodial staff, school police and Business Department assisted Nutrition Services in serving more than 700 students at Baldwin Park High School on March 25.

h2.a: Baldwin Park Unified Serves Nearly 131,000 Meals Amid School Closures

div.div:
Meals will continue to be served regularly after the week of Spring Break on Monday, April 20.
Read More »

img.alt: Free drive-through COVID-19 tests will be provided from April 14 through May 9 at Baldwin Park Unified Adult and Community Education Center.

h2.a: Baldwin Park Unified Adult School to Serve as COVID-19 Testing Site

div.div:
Free drive-through COVID-19 tests will be provided from April 14 through May 9 at Baldwin Park Unified Adult and Community Education Center.
Read More »

img.alt: Baldwin Park Unified will be distributing meals from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. on Friday, April 10 to provide for the week of Spring Break. Meals will continue to be served regularly on Monday, April 20.
. As a reminder, Thursday, April 9 is the last day for BPUSD families to submit a request to check-out a Chromebook for their students. Applications must be received by 11 a.m.

h2.a: Reminder: Last Day for Chromebook Applications is April 9

div.div:
As a reminder, Thursday, April 9 is the last day for BPUSD families to submit a request to check out a Chromebook for their students.
Read More »

img.alt: Help us ensure high achievement for ALL learners and be counted in the 2020 Census!

div.div:
Help us ensure high achievement for ALL learners and be counted in the 2020 Census!
Read More »

img.alt: As a reminder, school closures will extend through Monday, May 4, 2020 with a RETURN DATE FOR ALL STUDENTS ON MAY 5, 2020. These dates are subject to change based on the latest information from State and County guidance.

h2.a: Update on Remote Learning, Wi-Fi, Spring Break and More

div.div:
As a reminder, school closures will extend through Monday, May 4, 2020 with a RETURN DATE FOR ALL STUDENTS ON MAY 5, 2020. These dates are subject to change based on the latest information from State and County guidance.
Read More »

div.div: Baldwin Park Unified School District programs and activities shall be free from discrimination based on gender, actual or perceived sex, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, ethnic group identification, marital or parental status, physical or mental disability, or age, or on the basis of a person’s association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics. If you believe you have been discriminated against, immediately contact the principal, designee at the school office or District Office.
